sameAnalysis.part_name: 这两个形容词都含有"笨拙的"之意。
means: awkward ：侧重缺乏优雅、机敏和技巧。用于物时，指使用不便。
clumsy ：指人时，侧重行动笨拙；指物时，侧重制作粗陋或体积、重量过大而呈现笨重。

sentence.Network_en: Unfortunately, Grandma always seems to awaken at awkward moments.
sentence.Network_cn: 不幸的是，奶奶好像总是醒来的不是时候。

sentence.Network_en: Alexandra looked plump and awkward in her cast-off clothing.
sentence.Network_cn: 亚历山德拉穿着那身过时的衣裳，显得臃肿笨拙。

sentence.Network_en: I'm always being told off for being so awkward.

PerfectNetExp.abs: 新东方GRE词汇 - 豆丁网 ... awe ? n. 敬畏 awkward ? adj. 笨拙的 awl ? n. 锥子,尖钻.
(A-B)英语四级词汇表下载 ... awfully ad. 令人畏惧的；很 awkward a. 笨拙的；尴尬的 ax n. 斧子.

普特英语听力_百度文库 ... awful a. 极坏的，威严的，可怕的 awkward a. 笨拙的，棘手的 await vt. 等候.

list.abs: 雅思考试中，很多考生都会遇到无话可说的尴尬状况(awkward situation)。这会直接影响考官的评分印象(expression)，导致自身口语 …

derivation.yuyuan_name: late Middle English  (in the sense 'the wrong way round, upside down'): from dialect awk 'backwards, perverse, clumsy' (from Old Norse afugr 'turned the wrong way') + -ward

entry.tran: 使人尴尬的；难处理的；棘手的
entry.def: An awkward situation is embarrassing and difficult to deal with.

example.ex: I was the first to ask him awkward questions but there'll be harder ones to come...
example.tran: 我是第一个向他提出尴尬问题的人，不过还会有人问更难回答的问题。

example.ex: There was an awkward moment as couples decided whether to stand next to their partners.
example.tran: 大家在决定是否要站到自己配偶身旁时，这一刻令人尴尬。

entry.tran: 难使用的；难携带的；（工作）难处理的
entry.def: Something that is awkward to use or carry is difficult to use or carry because of its design. A job that is awkward is difficult to do.

example.ex: It was small but heavy enough to make it awkward to carry...
example.tran: 它虽然小，但很重，不便携带。

example.ex: Full-size tripods can be awkward, especially if you're shooting a low-level subject.
example.tran: 标准尺寸的三脚架可能会不便于使用，用于拍摄低角度的物体时尤其如此。

entry.def: An awkward movement or position is uncomfortable or clumsy.

example.ex: Amy made an awkward gesture with her hands.
example.tran: 埃米笨拙地做了个手势。

entry.tran: 害羞的；尴尬的；局促不安的
entry.def: Someone who feels awkward behaves in a shy or embarrassed way.

example.ex: Women frequently say that they feel awkward taking the initiative in sex...
example.tran: 女人们经常说她们不好意思在性生活上采取主动。

example.ex: He was rather awkward with his godson.
example.tran: 在教子面前，他非常局促不安。

entry.tran: 不可理喻的；难打交道的；难相处的
entry.def: If you say that someone is awkward, you are critical of them because you find them unreasonable and difficult to live with or deal with.

example.ex: She's got to an age where she is being awkward.

means.word_mean: 2. lacking grace or skill in manner or movement or performance;

sentences.sentence: "too awkward with a needle to make her own clothes"
"his clumsy fingers produced an awkward knot"

means.word_mean: 3. difficult to handle or manage especially because of shape;

sentences.sentence: "the cello, a rather ungainly instrument for a girl"

means.word_mean: 4. not elegant or graceful in expression;

sentences.sentence: "if the rumor is true, can anything be more inept than to repeat it now?"

means.word_mean: 5. hard to deal with; especially causing pain or embarrassment;

sentences.sentence: "awkward (or embarrassing or difficult) moments in the discussion"
"in the unenviable position of resorting to an act he had planned to save for the climax of the campaign"

means.word_mean: 6. not at ease socially; unsure and constrained in manner;

sentences.sentence: "ill at ease among eddies of people he didn't know"

auth_sentence.content: This is more than a little awkward, intellectually.
auth_sentence.res_content: This is more than a little awkward, intellectually.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: This is more than a little awkward, intellectually.

auth_sentence.content: There was an awkward moment after the others left.
auth_sentence.res_content: There was an awkward moment after the others left.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: There was an awkward moment after the others left.

auth_sentence.content: Walton saw genius in the awkward, self-conscious Roth.
auth_sentence.res_content: Walton saw genius in the awkward, self-conscious Roth.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: Walton saw genius in the awkward, self-conscious Roth.

means.word_mean: 不优美的；难看的；不舒适的

sentences.cn: 她是一个笨手笨脚的女孩。

sentences.en: John is so shy and awkward that everyone notices him.
sentences.cn: 约翰如此害羞狼狈, 以至于大家都注意到了他。

jushi.english: It was an awkward time to call.
jushi.chinese: 这个时间打电话是令人尴尬的。

jushi.english: The new garage made an awkward addition to the house.
jushi.chinese: 新建的汽车车库与房子不相称,有点不伦不类。

jushi.english: He asked me such an awkward question that I did not know what to reply.
jushi.chinese: 他向我提了个十分尴尬的问题,我真不知道该怎样答复。
